title: Introduction
text: first step using package make sure R markdown document uses version 4 bootstrap: bs4cards package takes name cards system introduced bootstrap version 4, work properly used R markdown documents rely bootstrap version 3. ensure using bootstrap 4, need edit YAML header document specify version bootstrap want use. example, relevant section YAML might use simple R markdown site overrides R markdown defaults ensure output built using bootstrap 4.5. enable bootstrap 4 pkgdown site one, edit _pkgdown.yml file include following may need update development version pkgdown make work.
code: output:   html_document:     theme:       version: 4 template:   bootstrap: 4

title: Introduction
text: main function bs4cards card() function. create minimal text-card, call card() function specifying title text arguments: minimal bootstrap 4 card containing title text cases ’ll also want add image card using image argument. argument specifies path image file. purposes example ’ll set image paths using links placekitten.com: image top card placekitten.com. cute Images placed top card default, can moved bottom setting image_align = "bottom": image bottom card placekitten.com. still cute cases ’ll want cards associated link, set specifying link argument card(). convert card title image links: image top card placekitten.com. cute
code: library(bs4cards)  card(   title = "A bootstrap card",    text = "This is a minimal bootstrap 4 card containing title and text" ) card(   title = "A kitten card",   image = "https://placekitten.com/300/200",   text = "The image at the top of this card is from placekitten.com. It's very cute" ) card(   title = "A kitten card",   image = "https://placekitten.com/300/200",   text = "The image at the bottom of this card is from placekitten.com. It's still cute",   image_align = "bottom" ) card(   title = "Placekittens",   image = "https://placekitten.com/300/200",   text = "The image at the top of this card is from placekitten.com. It's very cute",   link = "https://placekitten.com" )

title: Introduction

code: sample_card() kitty_list <- list(   sample_card(), sample_card(), sample_card(), sample_card(),   sample_card(), sample_card(), sample_card(), sample_card() ) card_grid(kitty_list)

code: card(   title = "A kitten card",   image = "https://placekitten.com/300/200",   text = "The image at the top of this card is from placekitten.com. It's very cute",   header = "Header",   footer = "Footer" ) kitties_with_footers <- list(   sample_card(footer = "Kitten A"),    sample_card(footer = "Kitten B"),    sample_card(footer = "Kitten C") )   card_grid(kitties_with_footers) kitties_with_headers <- list(   sample_card(header = "Kitten A"),    sample_card(header = "Kitten B"),    sample_card(header = "Kitten C") )  card_grid(kitties_with_headers)

title: Introduction
text: layout bootstrap cards different sized devices controlled grid system. display divided 12 vertical columns, bootstrap col CSS classes can used specify many columns spanned card responsive way. bs4cards package makes functionality available bs_col() function. default, card generated bs4cards width: devices medium (larger) size, col-md-4 class applies, card spans 4 12 columns, allowing three cards laid horizontally. smaller devices, col-12 class applied, consequence card spans 12 columns. card() function width argument can used modify default: small devices card spans 12 columns, medium devices spans 6, large devices spans 4 columns makes possible build card grids contain cards different width. medium larger devices right card twice wide left card. smaller devices, however, cards revert full width laid one : narrow card wide card
code: bs_col(medium = 4) #> [1] "col-12 col-md-4" card(   text = "On small devices this card spans 12 columns, on medium devices it spans 6, and on large devices it spans 4 columns",   width = bs_col(medium = 6, large = 4)  ) uneven_cards <- list(   card(text = "A narrow card", width = bs_col(medium = 4)),   card(text = "A wide card", width = bs_col(medium = 8)) )  card_grid(uneven_cards)

title: Introduction
text: bs4cards package also allows control margins padding cards using bs_mar() bs_pad() functions. default, cards generated card() margins. Setting margins around cards allows cards within grid separated one another: first card second card bs_mar() function also allows finer grained control setting margins separately side card: first card second card bs_pad() function operates similarly. default card() applies moderate amount padding sides (default bs_pad(2)). override , specify pad argument shown : card applies default padding card padding
code: spaced_cards <- list(   card(text = "The first card", margin = bs_mar(2)),   card(text = "The second card", margin = bs_mar(2)) )  card_grid(spaced_cards) spaced_cards <- list(   card(text = "The first card", margin = bs_mar(right = 2)),   card(text = "The second card", margin = bs_mar(top = 5)) )  card_grid(spaced_cards) padded_cards <- list(      card(     title = "A kitten card",     image = "https://placekitten.com/300/200",     text = "This card applies the default padding",     margin = bs_mar(2)   ),      card(     title = "A kitten card",     image = "https://placekitten.com/300/200",     text = "This card has no padding",     margin = bs_mar(2),     pad = bs_pad(0)   ) )  card_grid(padded_cards)

title: Introduction
text: bs4cards package also provides functions allow finer grain control individual components card, card_title(), card_image(), card_footer(). intention functions allow user exercise high degree control appearance cards. work progress :-)

what: An R package for bootstrap 4 cards
title: An R package for bootstrap 4 cards
text: creating R markdown websites, often find wanting organise content nice-looking grid links. goal bs4cards task little easier inside R markdown document website. can install development version GitHub : functionality package outlined introduction article.
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("djnavarro/bs4cards")

title: Construct bootstrap column classes — bs_col
code: bs_col(   base = 12,   small = NULL,   medium = NULL,   large = NULL,   extra_large = NULL,   more = NULL )

title: Construct bootstrap margin classes — bs_mar
code: bs_mar(base = 0, bottom = NULL, top = NULL, left = NULL, right = NULL)

title: Construct bootstrap padding classes — bs_pad
code: bs_pad(base = 0, bottom = NULL, top = NULL, left = NULL, right = NULL)

title: Specifies a bootstrap card — card
code: card(   title = NULL,   text = NULL,   image = NULL,   link = NULL,   image_align = "top",   width = bs_col(medium = 4),   margin = bs_mar(base = 0),   padding = bs_pad(base = 2),   footer = NULL,   header = NULL )
